description: I was looking for a fast and simple notetaking app. On MacOS, I used to use NotationalVelocity (nvalt). On Linux, the Notorious App is precisely what I was looking for.
Use Syncthing to sync with Android. As other commenter said, this app goes well with Markor (on Android)
Simple, clean, effective. I have the launcher bound to meta+N, jot something down, alt+f4, it's autosaved for later. Most efficient note-taking workflow possible (for simple notes).
Brilliant idea just to use the search bar the way this app does. The moment I figured it out, I was impressed.

I've tried almost every single note app from the PureOS store with a frown until I found Notorius. Simple but effective and stable note editor that does the job! It could certainly use a few more features like the ability to change font and colour, or opening multiple notes at once but overall, its great and happy with what it offers.

I was using Builder for my Markdown notes before. That was obviously slow and it had way too much UI, you needed to save manually, etc.

Notorious however is small, has very little UI, and perfectly complements Markor on Android.
i like the concept and simplicity
